name: places/ChIJ04Y22b1YwokRdDv0ibFykvw
formattedAddress: 1195 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1195 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028-1404, USA

editorialSummary.text: High-end storefront featuring a lineup of dog apparel & accessories, plus grooming services.

originalText.text: A very upscale, uppaw maybe? Service was very good. Attentive as soon as I walked in. Stopped by to pick up some treats and a gift for my pups 7th birthday. A good selection of USA made natural treats. Lots of clothing for your dogs too.

text.text: A very upscale, uppaw maybe? Service was very good. Attentive as soon as I walked in. Stopped by to pick up some treats and a gift for my pups 7th birthday. A good selection of USA made natural treats. Lots of clothing for your dogs too.

originalText.text: I am writing this review because the people that work in this store are truly wonderful. I just witnessed a white woman yelling at several employees because the color the the doggy sweater she was looking for was the incorrect (in her words, “ugly”) shade of green. She demanded the store pay for her $20 cab because she was sent from another store that didn’t have the color she wanted in stock to this one presumably because someone told her they had it in stock. The employees were so gracious and apologetic and informed her that they didn’t not have the color and size she wanted. She repeatedly told them to “go look again! Did anyone actually look!?” “I took a $20 cab here so someone should pay for my cab. So ur just saying ‘screw the customer’? I need to speak to the manager!” She was one of the rudest customers I have ever witnessed in NYC.  She then took a call on her phone as I was paying and I overheard her say “my driver just picked up the kids” — this woman has a driver and is asking for this small business to pay for her $20 cab ride! Absolutely outrageous! Her name was JOANNE. The staff should not have to put up with this treatment. They should be commended for their patience and professionalism. They are doing a great job keeping the store neat and tidy, and are very helpful at finding what you are looking for.

originalText.text: We received a very large gift certificate for Canine Styles that we neglected to use. The gift certificate was only valid for one year and it expired a year ago. Without asking for any details, the store refused to honor one cent of it. I'll buy my gifts somewhere else!!!

text.text: We received a very large gift certificate for Canine Styles that we neglected to use. The gift certificate was only valid for one year and it expired a year ago. Without asking for any details, the store refused to honor one cent of it. I'll buy my gifts somewhere else!!!

originalText.text: On the left I purchased the Wellness puppy bites from Citipups in Chelsea last week, price tag shows 5.99. On the right I purchased the same thing today from Canine Styles for a whooping 100% more at 12.00. Its 4.49 on Amazon. What's with the ridiculous overpricing?

text.text: On the left I purchased the Wellness puppy bites from Citipups in Chelsea last week, price tag shows 5.99. On the right I purchased the same thing today from Canine Styles for a whooping 100% more at 12.00. Its 4.49 on Amazon. What's with the ridiculous overpricing?

originalText.text:
Do yourself a favor and just go to Petco. The staff here are only attentive when they are trying to force sell you something. Everything in the store is absurdly overpriced, with absolutely no shame.

I bought a brush I was pressured into by a sales associate, being told it would deshed my short hair dog. I was skeptical and asked if she was sure 3x. She *assured* me it would. It did no such thing.

I went to return it and they told me they don’t take refunds, only store credit. There was nothing of remote value I could find for $20, so spent an additional $10 to not have the $20 wasted. Then, there is only one person who can do exchanges, so I had to wait while she finished a phone convo with an employee that was dragging and non urgent.

Huge waste of time and money, and they’re not even nice people. You will get fairer prices, a real return policy, and nicer employees at petco. I wanted to support a small business but unfortunately this place isn’t worth it.

Then, there is only one person who can do exchanges, so I had to wait while she finished a phone convo with an employee that was dragging and non urgent.

Huge waste of time and money, and they’re not even nice people. You will get fairer prices, a real return policy, and nicer employees at petco. I wanted to support a small business but unfortunately this place isn’t worth it.
